Title: Prove that every subgroup of an abelian group is a normal subgroup.
Content: Prove that every subgroup of an abelian group is a normal subgroup.
AcceptedAnswer: The definition of a normal group is: A group $H\leq G$ is a normal subgroup if for any $g\in G$, the set $gH$ equals the set $Hg$. Equivalently, you can also demand $H=gHg^{-1}$. Now, take a subgroup $H$ of an abelian group $G$. Take any element $x\in gHg^{-1}$. By definition, this element must equal $ghg^{-1}$ for some $h\in H$. Now you have $x=ghg^{-1}$, where $g\in G$ and $h\in H$. Can you prove $x\in H$?
